Text: [[b]]Captain Retinues[[/b]]\\n\\nInstead of heroic characters, House of Yuan can employ lower-ranked officers and captains who lead retinues of various unit compositions.\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Leading their men as first amongst equals, captains will follow your orders without hesitation.[[/col]][[/i]]
Old: [[b]]校尉部曲[[/b]]\\n\\n袁紹能夠不採用英雄人物，而是以低階軍官與校尉領軍，他們會帶領一群由各種單位組成的部曲。\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]校尉是以與兵卒平等的地位在前方領軍，他們會毫不猶豫地聽從您的命令。[[/col]][[/i]]

Text: [[b]]Fortitude[[/b]] is this faction's unique resource.\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]] With bravery and discipline, Liu Chong inspires his men and puts fear into the enemies of the imperial palace. [[/col]][[/i]] \\n\\n

Text: A carefully-placed strike hobbles the unlucky enemy.
Old: 精心策劃的襲擊，讓不幸的敵人措手不及。

Text: A charge from a squadron of Spear cavalry is a daunting sight for any soldier. But to see the warriors of Yan descend upon them is a new brand of terror altogether.
Mapped: 對任何一個士兵來説，一隊持槍騎兵的衝鋒都會令人生畏。但如果殺來的是燕國戰士，則是一種全新的恐怖。

Text: A charge of great power, draining Xiahou Yuan's focus.
Old: 發動強力的衝鋒，使夏侯淵耗盡專注力。

Text: A charge, fuelled by stern hearts and sterner blades, that will rip enemy lines apart.
Old: 以堅定的心智和強硬的刀刃發起衝鋒，便能一舉撕裂敵陣。

Text: A colonel of Xiliang has joined your faction.

A cowardly conspiracy! There was a failed attempt to assassinate you during the banquet. Unfortunately, the assaliant was slain by the guards before he could be made to reveal the conspirator's identity.
Mapped: 陰謀！有人於宴會中欲加害於你。事雖未成，但刺客已被护卫弑杀，無法得知是誰在背後主謀。
Override (manual): 陰謀！有人於宴會中欲加害於你。事雖未成，但刺客已被护卫弑杀，無法得知是誰在背後主謀。

Text: A cowardly conspiracy! There was an attempt to assassinate you during the banquet. Fortunately, it didn't succeed, but there is no way to know those who pull the string behind.
A cowardly conspiracy! There was an attempt to assassinate you during the banquet. Fortunately, it didn't succeed, but there is no way to know who pulled the strings behind it.

A decree has arrived from the imperial court. A banquet is to be held, and influential nobles from across China are invited to the imperial palace. Wary of our influence, the imperial protector may be plotting something. However, refusing an imperial decree may have grave consequences...
A devastating swing with the power of the risen inferno!
Old: 挾帶竄升烈火之力的毀滅一擊！

Text: After centuries, the old Han Dynasty has finally lost the Mandate of Heaven. Yet the people under heaven still suffer from the chaos of war brought by petty warlords and their false claims to the Mandate. My Lord, you must end this. China awaits a ruler who will bring unity and prosperity to the realm. How will you choose to rule the people of China?
Old: 經過數個世代，漢王朝失其天命。然而，天下黎民仍飽受各地宣稱帶有天命的軍閥，所帶來的戰亂之苦。主公，您必須終結亂世。天下正等待新的治理規則引導新的團結繁榮與太平盛世。您將如何選擇，治裡天下眾生？
克服萬難

Text: Be cunning and full of tricks and your people shall never be destroyed.
Old: 兵不厭詐，謀如湧泉，則手下士兵無堅不摧。

Text: Being a tribal people, the Shanyue are unused to the urban and decadent cities of the Han and prefer a life in encamped in the wilderness. Although not nomadic, the hill tribes are nevertheless a more pastoral, agricultural peoples. \\n\\n From their camps, they can both tend to their needs as a people and prepare themselves, militarily, for the ever-present and increasing threat of invasion from the North.
Old: 山越人乃是部落民族，比較不習慣定居在漢人奢侈委靡的城邑中，而習慣在野外紮營度日。雖然這支山地部族並非遊牧民族，但仍較倚重農牧。\\n\\n此族人在紮營地既可自給自足，也能有效準備兵力，應對北方持續加重的入侵威脅。

Text: Even as the Han crumbles, embers of its glory remain. These warriors serve the prince of Chenliu, Liu Chong. Clad in gold-lacquered armor, they form a resplendiscent sight on the battlefield, reminding all that the fortunes of the Han have not yet faded while these men stand firm. \\n\\n Gifted with fine armor from their prince, these soldiers expertly wield their halberds in defence of the Han. Advancing on their foe as a disciplined unit, they are a living reminder to the greatness of the Han.

Even as the Han crumbles, embers of its glory remain. These warriors serve the prince of Chenliu, Liu Chong. Clad in gold-lacquered armor, they form a resplendiscent sight on the battlefield, reminding all that the fortunes of the Han have not yet faded while these men stand firm.\\n\\n These particular soldiers are armed with crossbows, allowing them to barrage the enemies of the Han relentlessly with volley after volley of armour-piercing bolts. Should the enemy cavalry think to charge, they are in for an unpleasant surprise: these warriors also wield spears and shields and will not hesitate to strike down any horseman who comes too close!

Even as the Han crumbles, embers of its glory remain. These warriors serve the prince of Chenliu, Liu Chong. Clad in gold-lacquered armor, they form a resplendiscent sight on the battlefield, reminding all that the fortunes of the Han have not yet faded while these men stand firm. \\n\\n These royal guards are a beacon of hope to their allies. Gifted with fine steeds to ride, and clad in the heaviest armour availible from the princely armouries, each man has been trained in a myriad of weapons, from crossbow to the noble Jian sword and shield and is a veteran of many battles.
Even in the elite Xiliang army, having a big sword can only bring advantages to a commander.

Text: 'I have no choice but to pretend that I am a warrior who knows no fear.'
If even one arrow harms this man, those responsible will be condemned by all of China.

If only strength can rule, then strength must be displayed often and in great abundance. And it must be used to make an example of fools who would believe otherwise. \\n\\n Trained in the Xiliang style of warfare, these disciplined warriors form the backbone of the ironfisted rule that Dong Zhuo and Lu Bu impose upon the Han. Skilled with both the bow and the sword, they habitually patrol the streets to put down any unrest.

Text: In order to live in the shadow of the great wall and the tribes of the steppe, a people must learn to cope with hardship and discipline. Its soldiers must learn doubly so and are the better for it. \\n\\n Every army has their elites: those of the Xiliang army are more so than most. Armed with the two-handed zhanmadao, these warriors can bring any cavalry charge to a brutal standstill and make short work of their foes afterwards.

In order to live in the shadow of the great wall and the tribes of the steppe, a people must learn to cope with hardship and discipline. Its soldiers must learn doubly so and are the better for it. \\n\\n Every army has their elites: those of the Xiliang army are more so than most. These spearmen, clad in iron armor and wielding great shields, will hold the frontline of any army and drive the enemy back.

In order to live in the shadow of the great wall and the tribes of the steppe, a people must learn to cope with hardship and discipline. Its soldiers must learn doubly so and are the better for it. \\n\\n Every army has their elites: those of the Xiliang army are more so than most. These warriors, clad in heavy armor and riding equally armoured steeds, are the best the Xiliang have to offer. Though slow in maneuvers, almost none can oppose them as they charge into enemy ranks, trampling and goring their enemies on their spears.

Text: In order to live in the shadow of the great wall and the tribes of the steppe, a people must learn to cope with hardship and discipline. Its soldiers must learn doubly so and are the better for it. \\n\\n The courageous and experienced Xiliang army is the envy of most warlords and the pride of its leaders. After having thrown a spare hand-ji, these men will charge the enemy line, swinging their dagger-axes in one hand while the other holds a shield to parry retaliatory blows.

In order to live in the shadow of the great wall and the tribes of the steppe, a people must learn to cope with hardship and discipline. Its soldiers must learn doubly so and are the better for it. \\n\\n The courageous and experienced Xiliang army is the envy of most warlords and the pride of its leaders. \\n\\n These spearmen protect the flanks by pre-empting charges and bracing their qiang spears at an angle, so only the most foolish or brave cavalry dare charge them. This makes them a target for missile attacks, so they are outfitted in leather armour and carry large shields to protect themselves from the expected rain of arrows.

In order to live in the shadow of the great wall and the tribes of the steppe, a people must learn to cope with hardship and discipline. Its soldiers must learn doubly so and are the better for it. \\n\\n The courageous and experienced Xiliang army is the envy of most warlords and the pride of its leaders. \\n\\n These soldiers, armed with the long Ji, will brace and hold against cavalry charges, letting the horse impale itself on their blades. Wearing iron armour, they will wade into the melee confidently and take on all comers.

In order to live in the shadow of the great wall and the tribes of the steppe, a people must learn to cope with hardship and discipline. Its soldiers must learn doubly so and are the better for it. \\n\\n The courageous and experienced Xiliang army is the envy of most warlords and the pride of its leaders. \\n\\n Armed with crossbows, these soldiers rain down a hail of armour-piercing missiles on their foes. A wise general will support them with spearmen, as they are a prime target for enemy horsemen.

In order to live in the shadow of the great wall and the tribes of the steppe, a people must learn to cope with hardship and discipline. Its soldiers must learn doubly so and are the better for it. \\n\\n The courageous and experienced Xiliang army is the envy of most warlords and the pride of its leaders. Skilled horsemen such as these will ride the enemy down in a devastating charge and retreat before the enemy can launch a counterattack, or pepper them with arrows.

Text: It is a central tenet of Taoism that the land must be revered and nurtured; it, in turn, will return to us its bounties. Those chosen warriors who receive of nature's boons must use its gifts to pursue those who have contributed to the corruption and destruction plaguing the land. \\n\\n From the boughs of the trees, arrows and crossbows are fashioned and handled by warriors who wield them with greater expertise than most of their contemporaries.
Old: 在道家的中心思想裡，敬重土地、滋養土地，則土地必將恩澤人民。承蒙天地滋養的勇士，有責任運用這份恩賜懲奸除惡，平定四方。\\n\\n這些戰士拾柴造箭、削木做弓，箭法遠超常人。

Text: Mighty, gnarled monoliths, the imposing peaks of China's south stand like sentinels against the unrelenting waters beyond. Amongst these hills and peaks, the Yue tribes eke out their continued existence; brought low from the once-proud past, they stand now against the threat of Han invasion from the north. Although they wield sword and shield, they are nothing like the professional warriors coming to face them. \\n\\n Yet, united behind one who purports to fight for their ideals, the Yue are able to summon themselves into something resembling their own strength – their legacy demands it!

Text: Move swift as the Wind and closely-formed as the Wood. Attack like the Fire and be still as the Mountain. \\n\\n These elite soldiers hail from Danyang province and are rapidly gaining renown with commanders in the crumbling Han empire. Armed with a glaive and heavy armor, they have gathered a reputation assaulting enemy strongpoints succesfully and routing their defenders. \\n\\n Already, enemies have learned to fear their expertise, as well as the gunpowder bombs they carry with them. When the Blue Turbans have been spotted on the field, the foe knows their days are numbered.

They are furthermore armed with a light sword and cloth armor, so they should not be relied on to hold the line in melee.

Text: The fame of these horsemen reaches far. To fight the northern tribes, Gongsun Zan has created a skilled cavalry force of his own to match. These warriors follow their leader into battle, against the tribes or any other foe of the Han… \\n\\n Wielding a long spear and shield, these armored warriors charge into battle, skewering the foe with their lances. They only need to be wary of enemy spearmen and sustained archer fire.

Text: The imperial ancestral rite, a significant event in China, will be held soon. An imperial decree demands that you send civil officials to assist in administrative affairs or military officers for the imperial guard detail. If you fulfill your duties as a faithful servant, the imperial court will grant you grace. If you refuse, you may incurr the emperor's disfavour...
The industrious need no orders to galvanise them into action.
Old: 勤勉之人不需命令也會行動。

Text: The jian is a straight, double-edged sword known as the

The jian is a straight, double-edged sword known as the 'Gentleman of Weapons', and considered to be one of the four major weapons alongside the gun, dao and qiang. It takes a year of training before one is considered competent enough to use it, and so only the most skilled swordsmen are equipped with it. \\n\\n The role of the Elite Swordsmen is to hold the line against enemy attacks, and their swordsmanship, heavy armour and gourd shields enable them to do this long after others have fallen to exhaustion.

Text: The nomads of the steppes have a reputation for fine horsemanship. These particular horse archers have turned to banditry and pillaging to fill their coffers. They will allign themselves to bandit chiefs of note, who can afford their services by giving them a proportional share of the loot. In battle, they harass the enemy from afar, using their horses to quickly wheel about when the counter-attack comes.

Text: The role of these troops can be deduced from their appearance; their a

The role of these troops can be deduced from their appearance; their armour pieces are mismatched, put together by collecting those left in the aftermath of battle, or sourced from nearby villages. \\n\\n Their most important function is to search and collect loot, weapons and armour after the battle to put towards the Great Peace. They are not good at close combat, so they use a bunch of captured repeating crossbows to support frontline.
Old: 這群士兵的作用能從外表窺知一二：他們的護甲並非成套，而是收集戰後遺留的部件或附近村莊之物拼湊而成。 \\n\\n 他們最大的用處便是在戰鬥結束後收集戰利品、武器和護甲，以便在成就太平之路上添磚加瓦。他們會帶著長槍和盾來自保，有時也可上陣充數，但他們幾乎毫無武藝可言，而且容易潰逃。

Text: The royal ancestral rite is being held..
The royal ancestral rite was completed successfully, and the emperor shows favor to the attending princes.
The royal ancestral rite was completed successfully, and the Emperor shows favour to the attending nobles.

Text: The Southlands have long been the home of the Shanyue tribes, and it is their ardent hope that it always will be. This is the truth by which they live, and one they must fight to protect as warlords begin to encroach. \\n\\n The Shanyue know the hills of the South better than any, and amidst the striking scenery, their fortresses rise: places to live and grow, away from both the extremities of the elements and the eyes of the enemy.
Old: 江南一直都是山越族人的家園，他們也希望今後維持不變。這便是他們生存意義所在的真理，也是在諸侯割據的時代，他們必須奮戰保護的傳統。\\n\\n山越人比誰都瞭解南方的山區，並在這嶙峋之地建起了堡壘城寨；這裡遠離殘酷的風雨、也遠離敵人的監視，是他們生活成長之地。

Text: The sting of an arrowshaft can be deadly, but with these archers, death may still find you long after the arrow pierced your flesh.

Text: The typical bandit force consists of lightly armored troops. These men are not a typical bandit force. A string of victories or lucky looting has netted them the excellent armour wielded by the heavy troops of the Han empire. They now form a heavy spear unit, capable of holding their ground against even the dreaded barded horsemen. With these men, any aspiring bandit warlord may find himself a bandit king or queen, one day.

Text: The tyrant rages; his men hold through fear.

Text: The Yellow Turban rebellion and the rapidly collapsing Han dynasty has left many people without homes or livelihoods. The most desperate or least scrupulous of these turn to banditry. These men flock to the bandit of the king of Black Mountain, hoping to remake their fortunes through plunder and bloody battle. Despite their hopes, their poor equipment usually has them end up as fodder, while others reap the rewards for their sacrifices.

Text: The Yellow Turban rebellion and the rapidly collapsing Han dynasty has left many people without homes or livelihoods. The most desperate or least scrupulous of these turn to banditry. These men flock to the self-proclaimed bandit queen, hoping to remake their fortunes through plunder and bloody battle. Despite their hopes, their poor equipment usually has them end up as fodder, while others reap the rewards for their sacrifices.

Text: The Yellow Turban rebellion challenges the corruption

The Yellow Turban rebellion challenges the corruption that poisons China and has made many question old loyalties. \\n\\n These noblemen have renounced their former warlords to seek justice and redemption. Their previous life of privilege has trained and equipped them well, and they ride into battle clad in ornate armour and helmets upon impressive mounts of the finest stock. \\n\\n With sharp spears, the impact of their charge is merely a way to break the enemy’s lines for deadly close combat.
Old: 黃巾軍起義，劍指危害天下的腐敗，並讓許多人對心中舊有的忠誠觀念產生疑問。 \\n\\n 這些名門賢士拋棄了原先效忠的諸侯，轉而尋求公義，彌補自己的罪過。他們因先前的優渥生活而受過紮實的訓練，並擁有精良的裝備。賢士穿戴華美的護甲與頭盔，騎著威風凜凜的良駒駿馬踏上戰場。 \\n\\n 他們手持斧頭、舉起盾牌向前衝鋒，只為突破陣線，與敵軍來場你死我活的近戰廝殺。

Text: The yellow turban warband is crushed. Hailing from Qingzhou, the survivors offer their servitude. Cao Cao gathers them under his banner and dubs them Qingzhou Troops.
Mapped: 黃巾匪徒已被擊潰。青州生還者們願意報德。曹操將之收於旗下，名爲青州軍。
Override (manual): 黃巾匪徒已被擊潰。青州生還者們願意報德。曹操將之收於旗下，名爲青州軍。

Text: The Yuan clan's fame brings many benefits, one of which the number of men willing to lay down their lives in their service. \\n\\n Wielding the noble Jian blade, and protected by stout shields and good armour, these swordsmen will defend their masters with zeal. They form the frontline of the Yuan battleline, chopping and slashing at their foe until either they or themselves are slain.
Old: [[b]]陸政[[/b]]\\n晉陽女賊\\n\\n將領類型：{{tr:3k_general_type_water}}\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]狡黠之徒，矢不虛發，乃魁首之腕。[[/col]][[/i]]

Text: Their bolts remind the foe that even at range, noone is truly safe from the might of the Xiliang army.
Mapped: 他們的弩矢提醒敵人，即使離得很遠，在强大的西涼軍前也不會安全。
Override (manual): 他們的弩矢提醒敵人，即使離得很遠，在强大的西涼軍前也不會安全。

Text: Their energy is like a dragon.
Old: 他們具有如龍之力。

Text: Their heavy metal bows are short-ranged but can pierce through enemies.
Old: 此弓威力非凡。射程雖短，但具穿甲威力。

Text: Their own lives are not important, and they will somehow stop the enemy.
Mapped: 不顧己命也要阻擋敵人。
Override (manual): 不顧己命也要阻擋敵人。

Text: Their shots are almost always accurate even in the sand breeze.

Override (manual): 即使在沙塵中，他們也總能準確命中。

Text: Their thirst for battle goes beyond physical limits.
Old: 對戰鬥之慾求超越體能之限。

Text: There is a problem paying for food because of the new coin. We have no choice but to wait for the disturbance to calm down.
There is a problem with the market due to the new coin distribution.
There is a problem with the salary for the soldiers because of the new coin. We have no choice but to wait for the disturbance to calm down.
There is nothing to fear because the heaven is watching.
Old: 瞭解最佳的放箭時機，在輪到自己挨箭時便能收到奇效。

Text: There's a rumor about a nearby village. Each night, a huge monster terrorises the peasants. The villagers seek a hero to comb the mountains and drive out the beast.

Text: There's a sufficient number of horses.
There's no shortage of good horses.

Text: There's something about this strike that just feels off.

Old: 當受害者有所意識，情勢早已難以挽回。

Text: These concerned citizens call themselves the Bringers of Righteousness

These concerned citizens call themselves the Bringers of Righteousness and have used their wealth to purchase their own armour and weapons. Each has undertaken extensive training to become proficient using polearms and learned how to use a bow through traditional archery competitions. \\n\\n Though they wear expensive tunics, their commitment is not mere vainglory; their not-inconsiderable skill with the bow and polearm make them extremely useful due to their flexibility, and therefore welcomed to join the fight for the Great Peace.
Old: 這群憂國憂民之士自稱正道使者，用自身錢財購買護甲與兵器。每人都進行過各種訓練，能熟練使用長戟，並透過傳統的弓箭比試來學習箭術。 \\n\\n 他們雖身穿昂貴服飾，志向卻絕非虛榮賣弄。他們的箭術與戟法皆不容忽視，這樣的靈活多變對戰事有極大助益，也因此受到黃巾軍的熱烈歡迎，一同為太平而戰。

Text: These elite, battle-hardened bandits carry an axe in each hand, and advance ahead of the front lines to catch their foes unawares
Old: 這些身經百戰的精銳盜賊兩手各持一斧，率先出陣，攻敵不備。

Text: These fanatics will blow themselves up when they're in a losing battle.
Old: 當在近戰失利時，此單位將引爆自身。

Text: These military supplies were pillaged after a successful siege.
Old: 圍城成功後，我軍奪得了軍事物資補給。

Text: These soldiers obey only their own passions. They may charge without orders and act erratically on the battlefield!
Old: 這些士兵只順從自己的喜好。他們在戰場上可能會恣意妄為，不聽命令自行進攻！

Text: These tribes are reluctant to join Han Chinese society, but they can provide military assistance.
Old: 這些部落不願歸化，但願意提供軍事援助。

Text: These versatile infantry will solve nigh any problem their Wu commanders might face.
Mapped: 這些多能的步兵幾乎可以解决吳軍將領可能面臨的任何問題。
Override (manual): 這些多能的步兵幾乎可以解决吳軍將領可能面臨的任何問題。

Text: These warriors know how to control fatigue.

Text: These words will bring shame and humiliation.

Text: These words will fortify the spirit.
Old: 這樣的話語能強化心靈。

Text: To be the bolt of justice, to spearhead a charge deep into the enemy lines, delivering vengeance for an oppressed people, this is the task of these warriors. \\n\\n These cavalry are one of the few shock cavalry of the Yellow Turbans army.; once they have ploughed into an enemy formation with their spears, they have the armour and the skill to keep fighting, thrusting with enough force to pierce most armour with righteous intensity.
Old: 替天行道，衝鋒陷陣，為民除害，是彼使命。\\n\\n儘管以突擊騎兵而言這支先鋒部隊的戰力不算上乘，但他們以韌性見長，一旦執槍闖入敵陣，便能憑著良甲和武藝持續奮戰，哪怕是頑石般的盔甲也難以抵擋他們灌注義憤的一擊。

Text: To break these warriors is the challenge of many an army. So far, very few have succeeded.
Old: 多少軍隊試圖擊潰這些戰士，成功者寥寥無幾。

Text: To the very bitter end and beyond, if possible, to the very last breath, they will be constant and unswerving.
Old: 直到最後的最後，如果可以的話，甚至直到最後一口氣，此人都會穩守陣地、絕不低頭。

Text: Treat your men as you would your own beloved sons. And they will follow you into the deepest valley. \\n\\n Serving the heirs of Sun Tzu, these men would willingly follow them into heirs and certain death. Armed with a light glaive and medium armor, these men can hold their own in a variety of situations, facing down cavalry or infantry with equal skill. Their versatility has caused them to be fondly called “problem solvers” by their commanders and are given great respect, which they repay with loyalty.

Text: Wars are a costly endevour and one cannot hope to end this chaos without a sizable treasury. Show all under heaven that you possess China's wealth.

Old: 預測風向

Text: We are reaping the benefits of military rule.

We have contacted the Xiongnu and verified that the kidnapped woman is indeed Cai Yan. She has become the concubine of a Xiongnu chieftain. However, the Xiongnu offer to release Cai Yan for a significant sum of gold.
Mapped: 吾人已與匈奴聯係，被綁架的女子確爲已被匈奴王納爲小妾的蔡琰。匈奴提議，可以重金將此女贖回。

When fighting against or duelling other heroes on the battlefield, they will find their skill and prowess much improved.

Text: When weakest, Dian Wei unleashes his true power!
Old: 典韋在傷得最重時，才會顯露出真正的實力！

Text: Where the militia of the Han are pressed into service out of obligation, the Yellow Turban zealots rise to fight because it is the only way to carve a better future for the people. \\n\\n Their fierce determination makes them more effective than standard militia. They charge into battle, lightly-armoured and equipped with explosive materials, ready to rend asunder any who doubt or question the Way.
Old: 漢軍民兵是被迫服役效勞朝廷，黃巾信眾則是為了扶助天下萬民而挺身奮戰。\\n\\n他們堅守職志，比起一般民兵更加善戰。這些信眾執大刀著輕甲趕赴沙場，欲將質疑太平道的敵人全數斬除。

Text: Whereas some cavalry bring a primal, instantly shattering force to the battlefield, other mounted warriors are suited to the slower burn, embroiling themselves in the melee and staying to continue inflicting casualties. \\n\\n Whilst they get less power on the charge, their destructive capability increases dramatically once they begin hacking away at foes.
Old: [[b]]陸政[[/b]]\\n晉陽女賊\\n\\n將領類型：{{tr:3k_general_type_water}}\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]狡黠之徒，矢不虛發，乃魁首之腕。[[/col]][[/i]]

Text: Whether from the bodies of fallen enemies, or awarded for gallant behaviour, these [[b]]trophies[[/b]] reward an [[b]]aggressive approach[[/b]] to this faction.
Old: 這些[[b]]戰利品[[/b]]或來自敵軍屍首、或因功獲賞而得，兩者都是此勢力[[b]]積極作戰[[/b]]的回報。

Text: Whether near or from afar, these soldiers shall bring justice to any who would threaten their prince.
Mapped: 無論遠近，這些士卒都要為任何威脅他們主公的人討回公道。
Override (manual): 無論遠近，這些士卒都要為任何威脅他們主公的人討回公道。
Old: [[b]]陸政[[/b]]\\n晉陽女賊\\n\\n將領類型：{{tr:3k_general_type_water}}\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]狡黠之徒，矢不虛發，乃魁首之腕。[[/col]][[/i]]

Text: Whether through hooking, or hacking, axes have a unique ability to reduce the effectiveness of shields.
Old: 戰斧擁有削弱盾牌效果的獨特能力，不論勾扯或劈砍都管用。

Text: Whilst all Yellow Turban warriors are happy to wade into the heart of battle, the Gallants of the People were made to hold the frontline against enemies - to be anywhere else would be to waste their talent and ardour. \\n\\n They are heavily-armoured, though not as heavily plated as some other warriors, yet with great axe they are able to push back the advancing foe whilst deflecting blows. Where their mail may falter, their fanaticism never will.
Old: 黃巾軍志士個個不怕衝鋒陷陣，但是護民勇士尤其適合固守陣線，要是挪作他用可就浪費了他們一身的本領和熱忱。\\n\\n他們身披重甲，也許不若其他鐵甲兵士防禦周全，但可仰賴手中長槍盾牌抵擋敵軍、化解攻勢。正所謂甲冑可破，鬥志不渝。

Text: With the many wars that ravage China, militias everywhere have sprung up to defend their home and livelihood from bandits, yellow turbans, and invading warlords. Tempered by hard-won experience, these men have become adepts at war by survival.  Equally skilled in melee as with the bow, they over time bought horses to level the playing field with the more professional troops they often face. Many of these veterans now flock to the banners of the warlords, providing a rapid response force fit for a variety of situations.

Text: Zheng Jiang has selected her most ferocious bandits to act as her ‘Fists of the Bandit Queen’; their role is to act as shock-troops, sneaking behind enemy lines to terrify foes with surprise attacks early in the battle. \\n\\n Each carries a heavy fu axe in each hand, and the wounds dealt by them can be catastrophic. Striking terror requires these troops to be without fear themselves, but also means they can tend to be undisciplined and difficult to control once their blood is hot with battle
